intro: Umbilicus leucanthus, commonly known as the white umbilical flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking white petals and a central yellow stamen that resembles an umbilical cord. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its flowers bloom in spring and are pollinated primarily by insects. The plant is also noted for its medicinal properties in traditional herbal medicine.
